intro: Factorovskya, commonly known as the golden cup, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. The plants are characterized by their distinctive yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. They typically grow in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Factorovskya species are often used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive foliage and showy blooms.
